isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 7 Engine Service Manual - Engine Electrical - Cleaning and Inspection

step1.para: Carefully inspect wiring harness for worn conduit, frayed insulation or heat damage to wires. Repair or replace if necessary.
Inspect sensor and valve connectors for cracked connector bodies, bent or loose pins, chafing, and damaged or missing O-rings. Replace connectors if necessary.
Inspect each connector for the following conditions and replace, if necessary:

item.para: Corroded connectors and green, gray, or white deposits on metal terminals.
Terminals incorrectly latched in connector body or pushed back relative to other terminals in same connector.

Make sure that each connector has its seals in place. During disassembly, a seal may pull off of its connector and remain in mating socket of a sensor or actuator. A connector assembled without the correct seals can be contaminated with moisture and have corroded terminals, causing a poor electrical connection.

step1.para: Check engine wiring harness connectors, connector covers, seals, and cover shields for cracks, cuts or worn areas. Replace if necessary.
